intro: Agarista coriifolia var. bradei, commonly known as the Brade's agarista, is a species of flowering plant native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and elliptical leaves with a smooth texture. It thrives in humid, shaded environments and is often found in the undergrowth of dense forests. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
